ygtwzPCn.title: Converse conformational control of smoothened activity by structurally related small molecules.
ygtwzPCn.abstract: The seven-pass transmembrane protein Smoothened (Smo) is an essential component of the Hedgehog (Hh) signaling pathway that is critically involved in normal animal development as well as pathological malignancies. In studying Hh-related biological processes, it would be highly desirable if Smo activity could be instantly switched between activation and inhibition. Using Gli1-dependent GFP transgenic zebrafish and in vitro biochemical assays, we identified and characterized two potent Smo inhibitors, SANT74 and 75 (Smoothened antagonist 74 and 75), by screening a small molecule library designed based on the scaffold of Smo agonist SAG. These compounds are structural analogs of SAG with the methyl group substituted by a propyl or allyl group in SANTs. We show that SANTs and SAG exert opposite effects on Smo activity by regulating protein conformation. Our study represents the first demonstration of conformational regulation of Smo by small molecule analogs, and the combinational use of these Smo modulators in a temporal controlled fashion should be useful for studying Hh biology.

OVAGpAcY.title: Zebrafish tyrosine hydroxylase 2 gene encodes tryptophan hydroxylase.
OVAGpAcY.abstract: The primary pathological hallmark of Parkinson disease (PD) is the profound loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra pars compacta. To facilitate the understanding of the underling mechanism of PD, several zebrafish PD models have been generated to recapitulate the characteristics of dopaminergic (DA) neuron loss. In zebrafish studies, tyrosine hydroxylase 1 (th1) has been frequently used as a molecular marker of DA neurons. However, th1 also labels norepinephrine and epinephrine neurons. Recently, a homologue of th1, named tyrosine hydroxylase 2 (th2), was identified based on the sequence homology and subsequently used as a novel marker of DA neurons. In this study, we present evidence that th2 co-localizes with serotonin in the ventral diencephalon and caudal hypothalamus in zebrafish embryos. In addition, knockdown of th2 reduces the level of serotonin in the corresponding th2-positive neurons. This phenotype can be rescued by both zebrafish th2 and mouse tryptophan hydroxylase 1 (Tph1) mRNA as well as by 5-hydroxytryptophan, the product of tryptophan hydroxylase. Moreover, the purified Th2 protein has tryptophan hydroxylase activity comparable with that of the mouse TPH1 protein in vitro. Based on these in vivo and in vitro results, we conclude that th2 is a gene encoding for tryptophan hydroxylase and should be used as a marker gene of serotonergic neurons.

PRasX6iw.title: Kaempferol Identified by Zebrafish Assay and Fine Fractionations Strategy from Dysosma versipellis Inhibits Angiogenesis through VEGF and FGF Pathways
PRasX6iw.abstract: Natural products are a rich resource for the discovery of therapeutic substances. By directly using 504 fine fractions from isolated traditional Chinese medicine plants, we performed a transgenic zebrafish based screen for anti-angiogenesis substances. One fraction, DYVE-D3, was found to inhibit the growth of intersegmental vessels in the zebrafish vasculature. Bioassay-guided isolation of DYVE-D3 indicates that the flavonoid kaempferol was the active substance. Kaempferol also inhibited the proliferation and migration of HUVECs in vitro. Furthermore, we found that kaempferol suppressed angiogenesis through inhibiting VEGFR2 expression, which can be enhanced by FGF inhibition. In summary, this study shows that the construction of fine fraction libraries allows efficient identification of active substances from natural products.

YaFGpNtJ.title: A SNX10/V-ATPase pathway regulates ciliogenesis in vitro and in vivo.
YaFGpNtJ.abstract: Sorting nexins (SNXs) are phosphoinositide-binding proteins implicated in the sorting of various membrane proteins in vitro, but the in vivo functions of them remain largely unknown. We reported previously that SNX10 is a unique member of the SNX family genes in that it has vacuolation activity in cells. We investigate the biological function of SNX10 by loss-of-function assay in this study and demonstrate that SNX10 is required for the formation of primary cilia in cultured cells. In zebrafish, SNX10 is involved in ciliogenesis in the Kupffer's vesicle and essential for left-right patterning of visceral organs. Mechanistically, SNX10 interacts with V-ATPase complex and targets it to the centrosome where ciliogenesis is initiated. Like SNX10, V-ATPase regulates ciliogenesis in vitro and in vivo and does so synergistically with SNX10. We further discover that SNX10 and V-ATPase regulate the ciliary trafficking of Rab8a, which is a critical regulator of ciliary membrane extension. These results identify an SNX10/V-ATPase-regulated vesicular trafficking pathway that is crucial for ciliogenesis, and reveal that SNX10/V-ATPase, through the regulation of cilia formation in various organs, play an essential role during early embryonic development.

CBLmqkdx.title: Expansion of CRISPR/Cas9 genome targeting sites in zebrafish by Csy4-based RNA processing

EkBxZnAb.title: Characterization of two novel small molecules targeting melanocyte development in zebrafish embryogenesis.
EkBxZnAb.abstract: Melanocytes are pigment cells that are closely associated with many skin disorders, such as vitiligo, piebaldism, Waardenburg syndrome, and the deadliest skin cancer, melanoma. Through studies of model organisms, the genetic regulatory network of melanocyte development during embryogenesis has been well established. This network also seems to be shared with adult melanocyte regeneration and melanoma formation. To identify chemical regulators of melanocyte development and homeostasis, we screened a small-molecule library of 6000 compounds using zebrafish embryos and identified five novel compounds that inhibited pigmentation. Here we report characterization of two compounds, 12G9 and 36E9, which disrupted melanocyte development. TUNEL assay indicated that these two compounds induced apoptosis of melanocytes. Furthermore, compound 12G9 specifically inhibited the viability of mammalian melanoma cells in vitro. These two compounds should be useful as chemical biology tools to study melanocytes and could serve as drug candidates against melanocyte-related diseases.

pZeweb3U.title: Tissue culture of Baiyu chewing cane
pZeweb3U.abstract: [Objective]Using the Baiyu chewing cane collected from Guigang City, Guangxi as testing material, the main factors impacting Baiyu chewing cane in vitro culture was explored in order to establish the rapid regeneration propagation system. [Method]After using the tissues from Baiyu chewing cane’s slightly-tailing leaves as explant callus for bud differentiation culture of callus, adventitious bud proliferation, and plantlet browning prevention and rooting induction were conducted using different culture medium and hormone combinations. [Result]Baiyu chewing cane leaf slicing for callus induction was a convenient and effective method. After the whorl sections were connected with the culture medium (MS+2,4-D 3 mg/L, agar 5 g/L, sugar 30 g/L) for 30 d, explants rapidly expanded, the edges became granular, light yellow or yellow, and the embryogenic callus or paste callus displayed uniformed quality. The optimum culture medium for buds differentiation induction in Baiyu chewing cane was MS+6-BA 1.0 mg/L+ NAA0.2 mg/L. For the proliferation of adventitious buds, the optimum effect resulted from the MS+6-BA 3.0 mg/L+KT 0.5 mg/L+NAA 0.6 mg/L+ sugar 30.0 g/L treatment. To prevent browning effects, the PVP and activated carbon tissue culture seedlings had different effects; the 1% activated carbon could effectively inhibit the proliferation of adventitious shoots browning in Baiyu chewing cane culture medium. In the rooting culturing process, the optimal culturing medium was MS+ NAA 0.6 mg/L+ sugar 50.0 g/L + activated carbon 0.1%. [Conclusion]By the orthogonal design test, the regeneration system of Baiyu chewing cane breeding was established in order to speed up the breeding rate of Baiyu chewing cane, improve propagation coefficient, and provide an effective way for capital-saving.

bh7TBk7r.title: Screening Elite Sugarcane Cross Combinations by Fuzzy Comprehensive Judgment Method
bh7TBk7r.abstract: Brix,stalk height,stalk diameter,and number of millable stalks were the four main parameters that determine the quality of sugarcane cross combinations.In order to screen out elite sugarcane cross combinations for future breeding programs,the four parameters were tested and then analyzed by fuzzy comprehensive judgment method in seed seedlings of 24 sugarcane cross combinations from the Hybrid Nursery of Guangxi Sugarcane Research Institute.The results showed that,ROC24×YT91-976 was the best combination,and another 10 combinations were good viz.,ROC1×ROC22,ROC1×GT96-211,GT92-66×Zhanzhe92-126,YT91-976×ROC1,GT92-66×Funong91-4621,GT94-119×CP74-383,YT89-113×HoCP93-750,ROC10×Yacheng94-46,Yacheng99-31×ROC22 and GT92-66×GT00-245.These above-mentioned cross combinations could be planted for future breeding practice.

4ZgC44EM.title: Mitigation measures of low-temperature disaster of sugarcane
4ZgC44EM.abstract: During January 12 to February 20,low-temperature,snow and rain hit Guangxi,which was the first record in the past 50 years.It caused adverse effects to the sugarcane production in Guangxi.In order to timely valuate the disaster situation of sugarcane and direct the sugarcane production for farmers,combined with the disaster situation in different stages of sugarcane,the low-temperature disaster of sugarcane and their effects on the production was pointed out,and the corresponding mitigation measures and suggestion were put forward,too.

ovZI7rwl.title: Sugarcane Micropropagation through Shoot-tip Embryogenesis
ovZI7rwl.abstract: Sugarcane ROC22 was selected as the experimental material;multiplication rate,plantlet's quality and effect of virus-free were compared between different time for inoculating and different concentration of hormones of sugarcane plantlets from embryogenesis,shoot tips and apical buds.After 5 subcultures on MS + 6-BA 1.5mg/L + NAA 0.01-0.1 mg/L medium generated 2589 plantlets from embryogenesis,297 plantlets from shoot tips and 104 plantlets from apical bud.Quality of plantlets opposite to multiplication rate,some abnormal plantlet(white,slim,vitrification and crazy-growing plantlet) occurred in the three methods(incidence of embryogenesis,shoot tips and apical bud was 1.77%,1.56% and 0.31%,respectively).There was no significant difference between the different treatments of rooting rate and survival rate,the rooting rate of embryogenesis,shoot tips,and apical buds was 75.3%,76.9% and 76.6%,respectively;the survival rate of embryogenesis,shoot tips and apical buds was 94.8%,95.4% and 95.1%,respectively.MS+NAA 7.5mg/L+ABA 2.5mg/L was better for rooting.Plantlets generated from shoot tips embryogenesis was better for wiping off RSD and mosaics disease.The method of shoot tips embryogenesis for generating sugarcane plantlets is good for wiping off virus and enhancing the multiplication rate,and is better for overcome the problems of lower multiplication rate and high cost in sugarcane tissue culture.

pHUSSNYP.title: Research on the Formation of Arbuscular Mycorrhizae in Sugarcane
pHUSSNYP.abstract: Arbuscular mycorrhizal(AM) formation in plant roots of sugarcane ROC22 caused by Glomus sp1 infection was studied in pot cultures under sterilized condition.The results showed that fungal hyphae infected the plant roots epidermis efficiently.AM fungal could promote growth of sugarcane,resulting in better performance in plant height, leaf length,numbers of green leaves and stem diameter compared to the control.Research on the interaction mechanism between Arbuscular mycorrhizal(AM) and sugarcane plant had significance in sugarcane.

Az7oni1e.title: Rapid Propagation of Sugarcane (Saccharrum officinarum L.) Virus-free Seedlings by Temporary Immersion Bioreactor System
Az7oni1e.abstract: During the rapid propagation of virus-free sugarcane seedlings by employing TIBs,effects of different media,inoculation number,sucrose concentrations and sugarcane varieties were tested for two sugarcane varieties,ROC16 and ROC22.The results showed that after a three-stage propagation process,the multiple rate of ROC16 was 40 during a single inoculation,and the average seedling number was 800 per bottle.For ROC22,the multiple rate was 30,and the seedling number was 600 per bottle.

MjONJZGV.title: Analyses on the potential of sugarcane as a bio-energy crop in China
MjONJZGV.abstract: Based on the present petroleum crisis in the world,the necessity and possibility for developing sugarcane as a sustainable reproduced energy crop in China were analyzed.As a C_4 plant,sugarcane is rather high in light inversion efficiency,photosynthetic rate and biomass productivity,which make it the highest in net energy rate.Sugarcane can be cultivated extensively especially in upland area because of its strong drought resistance,and its productivity potentials still high in China.The cost for ethanol production from sugarcane is economically practical,and Brazil has been very successful in utilizing sugarcane as an energy crop for ethanol production in replacement of petroleum in considerable extent.It is considered that sugarcane is a most promising bio-energy crop in China.However,China needs pay attention to the breeding of new energy cane varieties,developing technology for the processing of energy ethanol production for cane and corresponding automobiles based on ethanol energy.

z0C2ESY5.title: The Analysis of Quantity of Plumbum and Deleading Reagent Added which Influenced Determination of Reducing Sugar in Sugarcane Juice
z0C2ESY5.abstract: [Objective]This paper aims to study the quantity of plumbum(clarifier) and the quantity of deleading reagent influencing the follow-up process of reducing sugar in sugar cane juice determination using Lane-Eynong method.[Method]Treatments of different quantity of plumbum(1.0 ml,1.5 ml,2.0 ml,2.5 ml,3.0 ml) and different quantity of deleading reagent(1.0 ml,1.5 ml,2.0 ml,2.5 ml,3.0 ml) are established so as to test the reducing sugar amount under different treatments.[Result]The lowest level of reducing sugar is obtained with 1.0 ml plumbum.When the quantity of plumbum is 1.5 ml,the higher level of reducing sugar is obtained.There had no remarkable increase when the quantity of plumbum is between 2.0 ml and 3.0 ml.Lower level of reducing sugar is resulted with higher quantity of deleading reagent.[Conclusion]The suitable quantity of plumbum is from 1.5 ml to 2.0 ml and the suitable quantity of deleading reagent is from 2.0 ml to 2.5 ml.
keywords: Reducing sugar in sugar cane juice

4BziuplJ.title: Application of LFS in Sugarcane Tissue Culture for Rapid Propagation
4BziuplJ.abstract: A new hormone was used for sugarcane tissue culture and rapid propagation.The stem apexes of ROC22 and its sub-cultured plantlets were used as the materials.MS basal medium supplied with different concentrations of LFS as the treatment,while 6-BA as the control in the differentiating and multiplication stage,and NAA as the control in the rooting stage,respectively.It was revealed that LFS could significantly retard the browning of the stem apexes and increase stem apexes' survival ratio.It also demonstrated that 2.5～3.0 mg/L LFS was suitable for differentiation,while 3.0～5.0 mg/L for multiplication,and 8.76 times of multiplication rate was got after three subcultures while 8.53 times for the control.Compared with NAA,LFS could induce the occurrence of adventitious roots and the appropriate concentrations were between 2.0～4.0 mg/L with the rooting rate more than 90%.LFS showed favorable application prospects in sugarcane tissue culture for rapid propagation.

0yQioxq3.title: Analysis on Quality Change of Sugarcane after Harvest
0yQioxq3.abstract: [Objective] The aim was to provide the reference for planting division and machining plan arrangement of sugarcane variety.[Method]The factors influencing the material sugarcane quality were analyzed through the study on the quality changes of different cane stalks including Guyin 9,Gan 95/108,Taiyou 1,ROC 22 and ROC 16,in different storage time after harvest.[Result] With the prolonging of storage time after harvest,the quality of cane stalks became bad gradually,the sucrose content,the gravity and purity of sugar juice were decreased,and the reducing sugar of sugar juice,weight lose and sugarcane fiber content were increased continuously.There was different in the difficult and easy degree of the different varieties quality becoming bad.Among these varieties, ROC 16 had the best comprehensive characters and its quality change was slow,which belonged to deterioration variety,followed by ROC 22,Guyin 9,Gan 95/108 and the Taiyou 1 was the worst.The quality of material sugarcane was greatly affected by high humidity,low temperature and strong sunlight radiation in a long time.[Conclusion] The deterioration degree of the material sugarcane quality was affected by variety,temperature and external environment.

cWSYxXGY.title: Effect of Exogenous Phytohormone on ex vitro Rooting of Micropropagated Sugarcane Shoots
cWSYxXGY.abstract: [Objective] To explore the ex vitro rooting of sugarcane shoots,so as to provide theoretical basis for the development and application of its ex vitro rooting technology.[Method] Micropropagated shoots of variety ROC22 were cultured on MS medium and the effect of three common exogenous phytohormone on ex vitro rooting was investigated.[Result] The culture medium supplemented with GA3 greatly promoted the growth and survival rate of micropropagated shoots.Compared with control,the survival rate treated with GA3 was higher by 2.2 times,especially when treated with 1.5 mg/L GA3,the survival rate reached 83.33%.After cultured on MS medium supplemented with GA3,height and survival rate differed at different concentrations of NAA and ABT,however,the differences were insignificant,which indicated that supplementation of auxins like NAA and ABT before transplanting didn't have significant effect on survival rate and later growth of sugarcane micropropagated shoots.[Conclusion] The study provide scientific basis for the ex vitro rooting for sugarcane micropropagated shoots.

BI4z6zCj.title: Root Induction Culture of Tissue Culture Plantlets on Guitang02-901 and 02-467
BI4z6zCj.abstract: Effects of different rooting media and culture environment on root induction during tissue culture were tested on new sugarcane strains of Guitang02-901 and Guitang02-467.The results showed that,for Guitang02-901,rooting media with 10mg/L NAA and 70g/L sucrose resulted in the highest root induction rate among the treatments;and for Guitang02-467,it was 5mg/L NAA and 30g/L sucrose.Rooting media containing active carbon could decrease root induction rate.After inoculation,the tissue culture plantlets were put in culture room and greenhouse to culture.The results showed the time of root induction would delay in aisle and greenhouse but the root induction rate were higher than that in the culture room after three weeks.

YeUqdW25.title: Factors affecting induction of callus and embryogenic cell cluster derived from young leaf sheath of sugarcane
YeUqdW25.abstract: In the present study,different sugarcane varieties,viz.,ROC22,ROC16,GT21 and Badila were used for investigating the effects of different differentiation incentive culture time at early induction stage,and hormone combinations(2,4-D 1.0-7.0 mg/L,ABA 0-2.0 mg/L) on induction or differentiation of embryogenic cell cluster.The 0-3 cm of young leaf sheath(near to growing point) was used as explants,and solid MS was used as the basic culture medium.The induction rate of embyrogenic cell cluster derived from callus of young leaf sheath increased significantly through incentive culture for 24-72 h in medium MS +6-BA 1.5 mg/L +NAA 0.5 mg/L,the highest induction rate(44.4%) was found when the plantlets were cultured for 48 h and it increased by 15.7 percent as compared to the control.It was found that the induction rate and growth of embryogenic cell cluster in different sugarcane varieties were better when cultured in medium MS+ 2,4-D 3.0 mg/L+ ABA 0.5 mg/L,followed by MS+2,4-D 3.0 mg/L.After differentiation culture in medium MS+6-BA 1.5 mg/L+NAA 0.1 mg/L,the differentiation rate of green plantlets derived from embryogenic cell cluster(cultured in media MS+2,4-D 3.0 mg/L+ ABA 0.5 mg/L and MS+2,4-D 3.0 mg/L) was higher than that of the other media by 65.0 and 64.9% of average differentiation rate,respectively,while the rooting rate of green plantlets was found to be lower.

sQRpEqWA.title: Comparison of Several Physiological and Biochemical Parameters in Virus-free Sugarcane Seedlings Produced by TIBs and Traditional Tissue Culture Methods
sQRpEqWA.abstract: In this study,the virus-free sugarcane seedlings produced by a new tissue culture way—the temporary immersion bioreactors system( TIBs) and the traditional tissue culture mode were used as experimental materials,and several physiological and biochemical indicators were analyzed in them during the rapid propagation period,root period and refined seedling stage respectively. Results showed the plant-type of viru-free seedling of TIBs were higher than CK in plant height,stem diameter,leaf number,leaf length,leaf width,and etc. The water content were not different between them. The chlorophyll contents,proline contents,soluble sugar contents,soluble protein contents and peroxidase activities were not different in propagation period,but higher than CK in root period and refine seedling stage. It is thus suggested that TIBs can produce stronger sugarcane seedlings that have a wider tolerance to stresses as compared to the traditional tissue culture mode.
sQRpEqWA.venue: Southwest China Journal of Agricultural Sciences

XyMvbiox.title: Tissue Culture and Rapid Propagation of Aglaonema commutatum Schott cv Treubii
XyMvbiox.abstract: Taken the stem segments with side buds of Aglaonema commutatum Schott cv Treubii as explants,the effects of different sterilization methods,inoculation methods,and different concentrations of plant growth regulators in medium on in vitro rapid propagation of A.commutatum were studied.The results showed that:(1) the more suitable sterilization method for in vitro rapid propagation of A.commutatum was wiping the explants with 75% alcohol in combination with treating the explants with 0.1% HgCl2 for 20 min;(2) the more suitable inoculation method for adventitious buds induction was inoculating the explants into culture medium horizontally;(3) the most suitable culture medium for adventitious buds induction was MS+2.0 mg/L 6-BA+0.1 mg/L NAA,and under this culture medium the induction rate of 94.10% was achieved;(4) the more appropriate medium for multiplication was MS+4.0 mg/L 6-BA+0.05 mg/L NAA,and under this culture medium the multiplication coefficient of 6.30 was achieved and the most suitable generation numbers for proliferation culture was from five to six;(5) the more suitable culture medium for rooting culture was 1/2MS +0.2 ～0.3 mg/L NAA,and under this culture medium the rooting rate of 100% was achieved;(6) and the survival rate was higher when transplanting to peat or garden soil medium under temperature and humid preservation condition.

tr5Cv1Jb.title: Detection of Ratoon Stunting Disease in Virus-free Seedcane of Saccharum officinarum by PCR
tr5Cv1Jb.abstract: [Objective]The study was carried out for providing good method to detect ratoon stunting disease(RSD)in virus-free seedcane of Saccharum officinarum.[Method]PCR method was used for the detection of RSD in virus-free seedcane of sugarcane.[Result]During the different growth stages of healthy virus-free seedling including proliferation stage,rooting stage,sand culture stage and temporary planting stage,the RSD detection results were negative.PCR detection sensitivity in the present study showed that PCR could detect RSD pathogen in the solution with bacterium concentration 10-3.[Conclusion]PCR method showed a good specificity and higher sensitivity,so it was suitable for the batch detection in the production of healthy virus-free seedlings of sugarcane.

ty7tW3K3.title: Determination of Organphosphorus Pesticides in Chewing Cane Juices by QuEChERS Cleanup and GC-NPD
ty7tW3K3.abstract: [Objective] To establish a method for determination of organphosphorus pesticides in chewing cane juices and prodivide safety guaranteeing.[Method] By using QuEChERS and GC-NPD method,a rapid analysis method for six kinds of organphosphorus pesticides residue in sugarcane juices was established,which includes dichlorvos,chlorpyrifos-methyl,malathion,fenthion,chlorpyrifos and triazophos.[Result]QuEChERS method could extract six organphosphorus pesticides residue in chewing cane juices effectively,which saved the organic reagent and time.Good linearity was found in different standard curves,the detection limits of apparatus was 0.020-0.100 mg/ml,recovery rate was 68.58%-92.85%,and relative standard deviation(RSD) was in the range of 2.16%-9.89%.[Conclusion] The sensitivity,accuracy and precision of QuEChERS method were consistent with technical requirements of pesticide residue determination.It not only can shorten sample processing cycle effectively,but also ensure that no impurity was in the sample peak and the recovery rate is also consistent with the requirements of residual analysis.

kKZ7R45f.title: Study on Outdoor Rooting in Bag of Virus-free Tissue Cultured Plantlets of Sugarcane
kKZ7R45f.abstract: In order to improve the outdoor transplanting survival rate of virus-free tissue cultured plantlets of sugarcane,the tissue cultured plantlets of ROC22 were taken to conduct outdoor rooting culture experiment in polypropylene bag,and the contamination rate,the growth status of root and leaf and the transplant survival rate of tissue cultured plantlets in different seasons and under different outdoor light conditions were compared.The results showed that the contamination rate of tissue cultured plantlets rooting in bag outdoor was 3.5% to 4.7% in different culture time,which was lower than that of tissue cultured plantlets rooting in bottle outdoor(8% to 14.5%),and the differences reached extremely significant;the effects of different light conditions and environmental temperatures on rooting rate and root number per plantlet were not remarkable;the high temperature season had a certain affection on leaf growth;light condition affected transplanting survival rate of plantlets,when light condition was 70%,the transplanting survival rate of plantlets were the highest,and the other light conditions all reached significant level.After transplanting,the plantlets that rooting in bag outdoor will grow quickly and strong.So,we can conclude that using polypropylene bag as container to rooting tissue cultured plantlets of sugarcane can improve the quality and the transplanting survival rate of rooted-plantlets.

avV0vOWq.title: Effect of Slow Release Fertilizer on Planting Sugarcane Growth
avV0vOWq.abstract: The compare experiment of three treatments of equal nutrient content,equal value and disposable fertilizing of Corbis brand slow release fertilizer was conducted with conventional fertilizer as control in Qinnan,Tianyang Longan,Xijiang farm,Huanjiang,Ningming,Tuolu and Yizhou areas.The results showed that the cane yield for equal nutrient content treatment was 5788.0 kg/667 m2,increased by 597.7 kg/667 m2;net income reached 567.91 yuan/667 m2,decreased by 104.57 yuan/667 m2.The cane yield for equal indifference value was 5372.0 kg/667 m2,increased by 181.7 kg/667 m2;net income was 751.61 yuan/667 m2,increased by 79.13 yuan/ 667 m2.The cane yield for disposable fertilizing treatment was 5473.8 kg/667 m2,increased by 283.5 kg/667 m2;net income was 989.22 yuan/667 m2,increased by 316.74 yuan/667 m2.

Si51QngV.title: Study on characters restoration of chewing cane Badila
Si51QngV.abstract: In the experiment,virus infected chewing cane variety Badila was used as the control,the characters restoration of virus-free chewing cane Badila were studied in fields.The results showed that applying virus-free treatment,the internode length of chewing cane increased 3.7 cm,the plant height increased 60.1cm,and the yield per unit area of chewing cane increased by 33.56%,suggesting that the growth and the yield characters of chewing cane were improved.Moreover,virus-free treatment also increased the content of chlorophyll and the activity of ATP ase in cane leaves,reduced the rate of mosaic disease,and improved the appearance and inner qualities,so the economic benefits were increased significantly.Therefore,it would have important significance and large potential that virus-free healthy seedlings of chewing cane were applied and extended in production.

fjfGEewQ.title: Effects of dark septate endophytes(DSE)on sugarcane seedling growth
fjfGEewQ.abstract: 【Objective】 The effects of DSE fungi on sugarcane seedling growth were evaluated to screen out the strains which could significantly promoted the sugarcane seedling growth and provide references for application of DSE on fertilizer and energy saving in sugarcane production and virtuous cycle of sugarcane filed ecosystem.【Method】Six DSE fungi imported from Japan were used to inoculate into plantlets and pot seedling of sugarcane to evaluate their effects on sugarcane seedling growth.【Result】The results showed that the fungi could increase plantlet height and dry weight of pot seedling at different level.The LtVB3 strain(Meliniomyces variabilis) had prominent effects on promoting plantlet height and dry weight which were increased by 68.69% and 56.66% at significant level compared to the control,respectively.The dry weight of pot seedling was increased by 40.00% compared to the control.The strains promoted sugarcane seedling growth in a stable manner.【Conclusion】There were isolates in DSE fungi which could well promote sugarcane growth.LtVB3 had prominent potential of development and utilization in these imported DSE isolates.

30xZaOxl.title: Rapid Propagation of Virus-free Sugarcane Plantlets via Temporary Immersion Bioreactor System
30xZaOxl.abstract: By employing temporary immersion bioreactor system(TIBs),we studied virus-free culture of seedlings from sugarcane varieties ROC16 and ROC22,from medium recipe,inoculation amount,sucrose concentration,and variety difference. The results showed,using this method,that proliferation rate of ROC16 improved by 40 times,per flask generated about 800 plantlets; of ROC22 improved by 30 times,per flask generated about 400-600 plantlets. The results provided basis for using TIBs in rapid propagation of plantlets via tissue culture.

l6L525xq.title: Effect Analysis of Agricultural and Economical Character on Planter Choice for New Improved Sugarcane Varieties
l6L525xq.abstract: Sugarcane planters were interviewed and surveyed by Participatory Rural Appraisal(PRA) in Tuolu District of Chongzuo City of Guangxi,and random samples were pulled out to analyze the effect of agricultural and economical character of the sugarcane on sugarcane planter choice for new improved sugarcane varieties.The results showed that the effect degree order is ranged from maximum to minimum: yield >defoliation ability > ratooning ability > lodging resistance >adaptability> sugar content.

IBKEnyff.title: Effect of Sucrose-yield Promoter on Sugarcane Yield and Sugar Content of Sugarcane for Energy Varieties
IBKEnyff.abstract: [Objective] The research aimed to increase the sugar content and move up the squeezing time of sugarcane for energy varieties.[Method] The sugarcane yield and sugar content of GT22,GT26 and GY5 treated by sucrose-yield promoter were studied.[Result] Sucrose-yield promoter had some impacts on sugarcane growth,but had less impact on effective stem number and effective tillering of ratoon sugarcane.Sucrose-yield promoter had positive impact on sugar content.Moreover,Sucrose-yield promoter increased the neutrophilic invertase and decreased the acid invertase in sugarcane leaves of three varieties.[Conclusion] Sucrose-yield promoter could increase the sugar yield of sugarcane for energy varieties.So it was feasible in the production.

iM7cgHlj.title: Study on Analyzing Methods of Sucrose Content Measurement in Sugarcane
iM7cgHlj.abstract: In order to improve the efficiency of sugarcane breeding,four analyzing methods for sucrose content measurement in sugarcane were compared in this paper.The correlation coefficient and deviation of these methods were discussed.The result showed that using the one cooking method to compare with normal method,correlation coefficient was above 0.99,STDEV was 0.11.Using twice estimating method to determine sucrose content,the correlation coefficient was between 0.98-0.99,STDEV was between 0.18-0.19.The correlation coefficient was above 0.98,STDEV was 0.23 by using once estimating method.The efficiency of analyzing could be improved by using different analyzing methods.

pZ5o0fzl.title: Commercial Performances of Seedcanes in Different Generations of Virus-free Chewing Cane (Badila) from Shoot Apices
pZ5o0fzl.abstract: Seedcanes of the first(Treatment A),second(Treatment B)and third(Treatment C)generations derived from shoot apices of virus-free chewing cane 'Badila'(Saccharum officinarum Linn.'Badila')were used as materials to evaluate their commercial and productive performances.The results showed that the virus-free seedcane treatments were highly significantly higher in monthly terms of growth rate,plant height,stalk diameter and cane yield than the control(traditional seedcane),of which Treatment B performed the best in plant height,stalk diameter and cane yield,which were 41 cm,0.25 cm and 41.1% higher than those of the control,respectively.In quality characteristics,the virus-free seedcane treatments showed higher water content,lower fiber content and slightly higher sugar content than the control,while in appearance characteristics they were improved in internode length,uniformity and luster,and had lower disease incidences caused by mosaic disease than the control.The virus-free seedcane treatments also showed higher chlorophyll content and higher activities of both Ca2+-ATPase and Mg2+-ATPase in leaves than the control.The first generation of seedcanes showed some residual effects of tissue culture in that they produced bigger buds that were easier to germinate under better sunlight.

z1yNNyEs.title: Studies on ex vitro Rooting of Sugarcane Microshoots
z1yNNyEs.abstract: [Objective] To optimize the ex vitro rooting conditions of sugarcane microshoots,improve their survival rate and reduce the production costs.[Method] The effect of external environmental factors on the ex vitro rooting and growth of sugarcane microshoots was studied,the survival rate and plant height of in vitro and ex vitro rooting were compared.[Result] The high fertile substrate(commercial) was not beneficial for higher survival rate but promoted the growth of plants,while the lower fertile substrate(sand) was not beneficial for growth of shoot,but resulted in higher survival rate.The temperature,humidity and light intensity of ex vitro microenvironment should be changed gradually to natural ones during acclimatization through covering of plastic film and shading net and proper water management after transplanting so that sugarcane microshoot could be well adjusted to natural conditions at last.In addition,the in vitro rooting shoots showed higher survival rate and better growth than the ex vitro shoots.[Conclusion] The current study will help to develop the techniques for attaining higher survival rate of micro shoots and ultimately reduce the cost of large scale production of disease-free tissue cultured sugarcane plantlets.

dOR1CVRh.title: Study on Virus-free Culture Techniques of Sugarcane Stem Tip
dOR1CVRh.abstract: The experiment were undertaken to solve the problems of high contamination rate and severe phenol pollution in hot water treatment with stem tip culture to product sugarcane virus-free seedlings.The experimental results showed that it was need for different temperatures and time to different sugarcane varieties in the hot water treatment;75% alcohol pretreatment before stem tip dissection reduced the contamination rate;the phenol pollution was reduced when stem tip was dipped in axenic water or 150 mg/L PVP solution for 15 min.PVP also could promote the growth of the stem tip.There were both positive and negative effects to stem tip growth when added AC as medium,but the further experiment is need.

4dY26H1B.title: Influences of Substrateds and Temporary Planting Period on Transplant Survival Rate and Growth of Sugarcane Tissue Cultured Seedling
4dY26H1B.abstract: The vegetable soil and barren hill soil were taken as substrate to study the influences of different substrates and different transplanting time on growth of outdoor temporary planting seedlings of ROC22.The results showed that the vegetable soil and barren hill soil had the highest survival rate(93.95% and 94.07%,respectively) by using raw soil as substance and had the lowest survival rate by using mellow soil as substance;the seedlings planted in the same substrate but at different culture time,their survival rate will increased gradually with the improvement of temperature and lighting condition,which planted in mellow soil had extremely obvious effect;the highest survival rate of seedlings showed in May for the temperature and lighting condition in May are the best,and the difference between seedlings cultured in different substrates was not obvious;the survived sugarcane seedlings had the best growth in mellow soil,the better growth in the mix soil that upper layer was raw soil and bottom layer was mellow soil,the worst growth in raw soil,but the sugarcane seedlings in each treatment all meet the requirements of field transplanting cultivation;the tissue cultured seedlings had the highest survival rate(97.8%) in big seedlings,the better survival rate in meddle seedlings,and the lowest survival rate in small seedlings;the content of chlorophyll a+b had a little of differences between tissue cultured seedlings cultured in different substrates and transplanted at the same time.Therefore,it could be concluded that using vegetable soil and barren hill soil as substrate to culture transplanted tissue cultured seedlings will have a higher survival rate,shorten the outdoor seedling breeding time,and enhance the efficiency of seedling breeding.

UI8HQRE2.title: Diversity of arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi in sugarcane fields of Southeastern Guangxi
UI8HQRE2.abstract: [Objective]Distribution of arbuscular mycorrhizas (AM) fungi in rhizospheric soils of Beihai and Qinzhou sugarcane planting areas in Southeast Guangxi was investigated in order to provide fundamental references for mycorrhizal fungi resource conservation, and the selection and utilization of elite bacterial strains. [Method]The soil samples(5-20 cm)of rhizosphere were collected from Beihai and Qinzhou sugarcane fields, AM fungal spores were separated using wetting sieve decantation and sucrose centrifugation method, and identified on the basis of morphological characteristics of the species. [Result] Six spore species of AM fungi including 2 of Glomus, 3 of Acaulospora and 1 of Scutellospora were identified in the soil samples. [Conclusion] Among arbuscular mycorrhizas population in experimental sugarcane rhizospheric soils of Southeast Guangxi, Acaulospora and Glomus are in the ascendant. The strain A.sp1 presents the maximum in both of two sugarcane planting areas, and the special species of AM in Qinzhou and Beihai is A.sp2 and S. gregaria, respectively.

QS2lxOBI.title: Advances in research on virus-free meristem tip tissue culture technology for sugarcane
QS2lxOBI.abstract: The advances in virus-free tissue culture technology using meristem tip of sugarcane stalks were summarized in the paper with reference to developments in technique and its basic principles and the factors influencing virus-free tissue culture using meristem tip of sugarcane stalk. Currently, the combination and concentrations of various plant growth regulators, the composition of culture medium and generation of phenolic compounds in culture media during the culture are the main issues which are still remained to be optimized under different conditions. Researches showed that alkalinity and compounds such as malachite green, 2,4-D, thiouracil and TS preparation could enhance the efficiency of virus-free cultures in many crops. However, the use of these chemicals have not been fully exploited in sugarcane meristematic tip tissue culture. The optimization of some advanced tissue culture technologies such as temporary immersion bioreactor system, plant sugar-free tissue culture and rapid propagation technology has been discussed and use of novel technologies and modern equipments to enhance the production efficiency and reduce the production cost in tissue culture of sugarcane has been suggested.

Izke4Hhv.title: Arbuscular Mycorrhizal(AM) Communities Structure in Root and Rhizospheric Soil of Ratoon Sugarcane
Izke4Hhv.abstract: This research aims to reveal the symbiotic relationship between the Arbuscular Mycorrhiza(AM) and sugarcane. The rhizospheric soil and root samples were collected from 6 years ratoon sugarcane, then nested PCR and DGGE were applied in analyses. The results showed that the soil and root generated diverse denaturing gradient gel electrophoresis(DGGE) profiles for the PCR amplification, and the roots of ratoon sugarcane were infected by 6 different AMs.

bo0HxsOZ.title: A NEW CANE VARIETY-GUITANG NO.22 BRED BY ~(60)Co γ-ray INDUCED MUTATION
bo0HxsOZ.abstract: Guitang No.22 was developed through seed stems of Xintaitang No.1 exposed at a dosage of 80 Gy ~(60)Co γ-radiation.In Guangxi regional variety test,the results show that the cane yield and the sugar yield are about 106.95 and 14.21t/hm~2 respectively.Moreover,the highest tonnage of biomass and fermentable carbohydrates reaches about 188.1 and 48.92t/hm~2,respectively.Guitang 22 is a new variety which has the characteristic of both sugar cane and energy cane.
keywords: a variety characteristic of both sugar and energy cane

tMS5TGv9.title: The Behavior of Guifu98-296 in the Central Part of Guangxi
tMS5TGv9.abstract: Sugarcane cultivar of Guifu 98-296 was planted in the central part Guangxi,and its behavior was observed.The results showed that the germination rate,tillering rate,plant height and the millable stalks per hectare of Guitang98-298 were 5.5%,64.5%,17.0 cm and 21150 higher or more than that of the check variety ROC22 respectively.The sugarcane yield and sugar yield were 22.5 t/hm2 and 2.0 t/hm2 than that of the CK respectively.The difference reached highly significance level.The stalk diameter was 0.16 cm smaller than that of the CK and the sucrose content was similar to CK.GuiFu 98-296 grows quickly,with average stalk diameter,strong resistance to insects and diseases,and good ratooning performance.Guitang98-296 can be released in the central part of Guangxi,and it has the potential to replace ROC22.

18JIPl2v.title: Detection of Ratoon Stunting Disease in Virus-free Seedcane of Sugarcane by Real-time Fluorescence Quantitative PCR
18JIPl2v.abstract: The aims were to detect ratoon stunting disease in virus-free seedcane of sugarcane by real-time fluorescence quantitative PCR, establish and improve the real-time PCR technology system detection of healthy seedling of sugarcane ratoon stunting disease pathogen. Six sugarcanes ‘ ROC22 ’ with ratoon stunting disease were selected, and the virus-free seedcane by the healthy seedlings production process of sugarcane were obtained. Real-time fluorescence PCR was used to detect the ratoon stunting disease pathogen gene expression of tissue culture samples. The results showed that the gel electrophoresis of 10 different treated seedlings sample PCR products didn ’ t have the target band, the average Ct value were from 37 to 39. Ratoon stunting disease pathogen genes did not express in 10 samples. Ten samples of healthy seedlings did not carry ratoon stunting pathogens. The healthy seedlings in sugarcane production technology could remove the ratoon stunting disease pathogen thoroughly.

bQ85PSMO.title: The Yielding Ability,Stability,Compatibility and Resistance Analysis of ‘Guifu 98-296'
bQ85PSMO.abstract: The performances of new sugarcane variety ‘ Guifu 98-296 ' were analyzed to understand the values in use and breeding.The variety's yielding ability,stability,compatibility and the resistance were compared by analyzing the output (sugar cane stem output and sucrose output),the coefficient of variation and the regression coefficient;According to the sixth cultivate results of new sugarcane variety regional test in China.The stem yield and sucrose yield of ‘Guifu 98-296 ' were 115.56 t/hm 2 and 17.12 t/hm 2 respectively,is situated second and first separately in all tested varieties,reaches the remarkable level difference with the control,The effect value of stem yield and sucrose yield were 8.95 and 1.34 respectively,and also situated second and first separately in all tested varieties;the coefficient of variation of stem yield and sucrose yield were 12.03 and 11.53 respectively,and also situated eighth and ninth separately in all tested varieties;regression coefficient of stem yield and sucrose yield were 0.98 and 1.00 respectively;The artificial infection incidence rate of smut disease was 7.69%,was the 2 levels resistance;The artificial infection incidence rate of mosaic disease was 0,was the 1 levels resistance;the average injury to plant height rate was 17.91% under the drought condition;Conclusion: sugarcane variety ‘Guifu 98-296 ' belongs to higher yield and sucrose content variety,have good compatibility,the production stability is middle;Higher anti-sugarcane mosaic,anti-sugarcane smut,has stronger drought resisting ability.It ' s suitable for planting at dry and slopes land with less fertility.

Futd84Up.title: Study on the Factors of Survive and Growth of Sugarcane Bare-root Seedlings Transplanting in Field
Futd84Up.abstract: In order to decrease time of culture in nursery and prolong its growth in field,together with improving the yield of unit area and increasing the speed of propagation,we did the following experiments about bare-root seedling of sugarcane transplanted in field.Materials were the group-planting seedlings of ROC22 which were virus-free by tip culture.We compared the effects of different conditions of water and fertilizer before transplantation,time of transplantation,way of transplantation and the condition of illumination to survival rate and growth when single bare-root seedling transplanting in field.The results showed that,when controlled the water and fertilizer ten day before transplanting,the transplantation survive rate were 89.5 percent which reached very significance level than contract and grew well after survive.When the group seedling separated into single plants,more quickly transplanting,higher survival rate within four hours.The depth of transplantation had better in 2-3 centimeter,the survival rate would decrease less 2 centimeter,tiller would reduce or no more 3 centimeter.The transplanting survival rate can reach 95.8 to 97.2 percent when used the 70 percent shady net to overshadow.In other ways,such as transplanting in spring or in water-field,can increase the survival rate of bare-root seedling of sugarcane transplanting in field.In all,controlled the water,fertilizer,light shad and the depth of transplanting,we can transplant some vigorous and strong resistance group-planting seedling to field directly.

dvVcnczn.title: Study on the high yield management of virus-free chewing cane with dry-land cultivation
dvVcnczn.abstract: Under the micro-sprinkler irrigation condition,the growth physiological of virus-free chewing cane(VCC) cultivated in dry-land was researched.The results showed that compared to the control was not done any virus procedure,cane yield was increased 23.45%;the cane leaves chlorophyll content of VCC(2.30 mg/g) was higher than control(1.57 mg/g) by 46.62%;the leaf relative water content of VCC(102.46%mm) was higher than the control(97.97% mm) with 4.59%.The amount bleeding sap of VCC(776.19 mg/h·cm2) was over than control(609.02 mg/h·cm2) by 27.45%mg/h·cm2;the fresh and dry weight of VCC root were 135.47 g and 79.12 g,were increased 22.96% and 15.02%,compared with the control,respectively.On last growth stage,the number of completely unfold green leaves(functional leaf) of VCC was more than control by 1.3 leaves and increased with 20.00%.The green leaf weight of VCC was 0.458kg/plant higher than control with 36.31%.

Z9wicpee.title: MUTATION BREEDING OF NEW SUGARCANE VARIETY GUIFU 98-296
Z9wicpee.abstract: A new sugarcane variety Guifu 98-296 was selected by mutation breeding.In different sugarcane growing test areas of Guangxi,t Guifu 98-296 cane output was 118.95t /hm2,sugar output was 16.65t /hm2,and higher 32.98% and 29.07% respectively than those of ROC22 which was main variety in Guangxi,and the differences between the two were very significant.At the sixth national test for cane growing areas,Guifu 98-296 was the fourth in cane yield,and the third in sugar yield among all eleven participated varieties.The cane yield and sugar yield were significant 11.41% and 12.6% higher than control variety of ROC16 respectively,and the sugar percentage was 0.11% higher than ROC16.Guifu 98-296 grows quickly with middle stalks,strong resistance to insect and disease,good ratoon performance,and is suitable for growing in the drought and slope upland of Guangxi Province.

7iqYkWnH.title: Summary on the agronomic and yield perfomance of new sugarcane variety Guifu 98-296 in Guangxi regional trial
7iqYkWnH.abstract: Guifu 98-296,selected from the mutants of donor clone after it was exposed to physical and chemical mutagenic agents,is a new variety which is adapted to those cane fields on dry slope upland.In the regional trial of Guangxi,the average cane and sugar yield of Guifu 98-296 increased by 18.24% and 20.89% over the leading variety——ROC22(CK 1),and meanwhile increased by 24.86% and 26.98% over the ROC16(CK 2) respectively.In the production demonstration of Guangxi,its cane yield increased by 3.98% and 16.13% over the ROC22(CK 1,99.63 t/hm 2) and ROC16(CK 2,89.22 t/hm 2).In the high yield demonstration of Guangxi,its cane yield increased by 31.49% over the ROC22 at Pingxiang test spot,and its average cane and sugar yield increased by 22.94% and 23.54% over the ROC22 respectively at Baise test spot.

8yGILnCd.title: Study on the Effects of Cultivation of Virus-free Chewing Cane on Dryland
8yGILnCd.abstract: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the advantages of cultivation of virus-free fruit sugarcane over virus infected fruit sugarcane in the dryland.Selecting the third-generation stems of virus-freed seedlings and virus infected seedlings of black fruit sugarcane as materials,the comparative experiment of dryland cultivation was conducted under micro-spray irrigation condition.And yield traits,sugar cane stem appearance,quality,root,green leafy were investigated at the maturity process of fruit sugarcane.The results showed that,the plant height,internode length,stem diameter,single stem weight,and sugarcane yield of virus-free fruit sugarcane increased by 25.3 cm,1.24 cm,0.12 cm,0.6 kg,and 23.45% compared with virus infected fruit sugarcane.The ratio of sugarcane flower stems skin,field brix,soluble sugar,and cellulose content decreased by 9.45%,0.28%,0.17%,and 0.34% respectively.The dryland labor costs were lower by 46.03%.The cultivation of virus-free fruit sugarcane over virus infected fruit sugarcane in the dryland,which resulted in developed root system,more functional leaves,yield and economic income increasing,was a new way for the development of fruit sugarcane cultivation.

iUHQqpxk.title: The Equivalence Relations between the Ditzian–Totik Moduli of Smoothness and Best Polynomial Approximation in the Besov Spaces
iUHQqpxk.abstract: The best polynomial approximation is closely related to the Ditzian–Totik modulus of smoothness. In 1988, Z. Ditzian and V. Totik gave some equivalences between them and the class of Besov-type spaces B α, s p with 1 ≤ p ≤ ∞ and 1 ≤ s ≤ ∞. We extend these equivalences to the similar Besov-type spaces with 0 < s < 1. We also give some new equivalences by means of the behavior of best polynomial approximation. References REFERENCES 1 H. Berens Y. Xu K Indag. Math. (N.S.) 2 1991 2 Z. Ditzian V. Totik Moduli of Smoothness 1987 Springer-Verlag Berlin/New York 3 Z. Ditzian D. Jiang D. Leviatan Inverse theorem for best polynomial approximation in L p , 0 < p Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 120 1994 151 154 4 Z. Ditzian Multivariate Bernstein and Markov inequalities J. Approx. Theory 70 1992 273 283 5 Z. Ditzian V.H. Hristov K.G. Ivanov Moduli of smoothness and K L p (0 < p Constr. Approx. 11 1995 67 83 6 Z. Ditzian X. Zhou Optimal approximation class for multivariate Bernstein operators Pacific J. Math. 158 1993 93 120 7 Z. Ditzian V. Totik Remarks on Besov spaces and best polynomial approximation Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 104 1988 1059 1066 8 R.A. DeVore D. Leviatan X.M. Yu Polynomial approximation in L p (0 < p Constr. bLmWPj3w.title: Compressed Data Separation With Redundant Dictionaries
bLmWPj3w.abstract: Most of the data scientists face today might be classified as multimodal data, i.e., being composed of distinct subcomponents. One common task is to separate such data into appropriate single components for further analysis. In this paper, we consider data separation from fewer, linear, nonadaptive, and noisy measurements. We show that the distinct subcomponents, which are (approximately) sparse in morphologically different (redundant) dictionaries, can be reconstructed by solving the split-analysis algorithm, provided that the dictionaries satisfy a mutual coherence (between the different dictionaries) condition and the measurement matrix satisfies a restricted isometry property adapted to a composed dictionary. These conditions impose no incoherence restriction on the dictionaries themselves, and our main result may be the first of this kind.

72t9dMlI.title: Convergence rates of cascade algorithms with infinitely supported masks
72t9dMlI.abstract: We investigate the solutions of refinement equations of the form Mathamatics equation representsed where the function ∅ is in Lp(R s)(1 ≤ p ≤ ∞), a is an infinitely supported sequence on Zs called a refinement mask, and M is an s × s integer matrix such that lim n→1 M -n = 0. Associated with the mask a and M is a linear operator Qa,M defined on L p(R s) Mathamatics equation represented. Main results of this paper are related to the convergence rates of Mathamatics equation represented n=1,2,⋯ in Lp(R s) withmask a being infinitely supported. It is proved that under some appropriate conditions on the initial function Mathamatics equation represented converges in Lp(R s) with an exponential rate. © Canadian Mathematical Society 2011.

mJHquYE0.title: Smoothness of multivariate refinable functions with infinitely supported masks
mJHquYE0.abstract: In this paper, we investigate the smoothness of multivariate refinable functions with infinitely supported masks and an isotropic dilation matrix. Using some methods as in [R.Q. Jia, Characterization of smoothness of multivariate refinable functions in Sobolev spaces, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 351 (1999) 4089-4112], we characterize the optimal smoothness of multivariate refinable functions with polynomially decaying masks and an isotropic dilation matrix. Our characterizations extend some of the main results of the above mentioned paper with finitely supported masks to the case in which masks are infinitely supported.

qirz8YQZ.title: Wavelets and framelets from dual pseudo splines
qirz8YQZ.abstract:
Dual pseudo splines constitute a new class of refinable functions with B-splines as special examples. In this paper, we shall
 construct Riesz wavelet associated with dual pseudo splines. Furthermore, we use dual pseudo splines to construct tight frame
 systems with desired approximation order by applying the unitary extension principle.

LBnstVeN.title: Complex Wavelets and Framelets from Pseudo Splines
LBnstVeN.abstract:
In this paper, we introduce complex pseudo splines that are derived from pseudo splines of type I. First, we show that the
 shifts of every complex pseudo spline are linearly independent. Therefore we can construct a biorthogonal wavelet system.
 Next, we investigate the Riesz basis property of the corresponding wavelet system generated by complex pseudo splines. The
 regularity of the complex pseudo splines will be analyzed. Furthermore, by using complex pseudo splines, we will construct
 symmetric or antisymmetric complex tight framelets with desired approximation order.
keywords: complex pseudo splines · complex tight frame · complex riesz wavelets · biorthogonal complex refinable function · dual frame

juynUmve.title: Refinable Functions with Exponential Decay: An Approach via Cascade Algorithms
juynUmve.abstract: Refinable functions with exponential decay arise from applications such as the Butterworth filters in signal processing. Refinable functions with exponential decay also play an important role in the study of Riesz bases of wavelets generated from multiresolution analysis. A fundamental problem is whether the standard solution of a refinement equation with an exponentially decaying mask has exponential decay. We investigate this fundamental problem by considering cascade algorithms in weighted Lp spaces (1≤p≤∞). We give some sufficient conditions for the cascade algorithm associated with an exponentially decaying mask to converge in weighted Lp spaces. Consequently, we prove that the refinable functions associated with the Butterworth filters are continuous functions with exponential decay. By analyzing spectral properties of the transition operator associated with an exponentially decaying mask, we find a characterization for the corresponding refinable function to lie in weighted L2 spaces. The general theory is applied to an interesting example of bivariate refinable functions with exponential decay, which can be viewed as an extension of the Butterworth filters. © 2011 Springer Science+Business Media, LLC.

x63oD0M7.title: Shearlet frames with short support
x63oD0M7.abstract:
Compactly supported shearlets have been studied in both theory and
applications. In this paper, we construct symmetric compactly supported
shearlet systems based on pseudo splines of type II. Specially, using
B-splines, we construct shearlet frame having explicit analytical forms which
is important for applications. The shearlet systems based on B-splines also
provide optimally sparse approximation within cartoon-liked image.

iLBfk8iX.title: Restricted p---isometry property and its application for nonconvex compressive sensing
iLBfk8iX.abstract: Compressed sensing is a new scheme which shows the ability to recover sparse signal from fewer measurements, using l 1 minimization. Recently, Chartrand and Staneva showed in Chartrand and Staneva (Inverse Problems 24:1---14, 2009) that the l p minimization with 0驴p驴l 1 minimization. They proved that l p minimization with 0驴p驴S-sparse signals x驴驴驴驴 N from fewer Gaussian random measurements for some smaller p with probability exceeding $$ 1 - 1 \Bigg/ {N\choose S}. $$ The first aim of this paper is to show that above result is right for the case of Gaussian random measurements with probability exceeding 1驴驴驴2e 驴驴驴c(p)M , where M is the numbers of rows of Gaussian random measurements and c(p) is a positive constant that guarantees $1-2e^{-c(p)M}1 - 1 / {N\choose S}$ for p smaller. The second purpose of the paper is to show that under certain weaker conditions, decoders Δ p are stable in the sense that they are (2,p) instance optimal for a large class of encoder for 0驴p驴

9l9LMPeJ.title: General A-P iterative algorithm in shift-invariant spaces
9l9LMPeJ.abstract:
A general A-P iterative algorithm in a shift-invariant space is presented. We use the algorithm to show reconstruction of
 signals from weighted samples and also show that the general improved algorithm has better convergence rate than the existing
 one. An explicit estimate for a guaranteed rate of convergence is given.

WXpLLd2s.title: The support of a refinable vector satisfying an inhomogeneous refinement equation
WXpLLd2s.abstract:
In this paper, we investigate the support of a refinable vector satisfying an inhomogeneous refinement equation. By using
 some methods introduced by So and Wang, an estimate is given for the support of each component function of a compactly supported
 refinable vector satisfying an inhomogeneous matrix refinement equation with finitely supported masks.

hKJNJVUp.title: Subdivision schemes with polynomially decaying masks
hKJNJVUp.abstract:
In this paper we investigate the L
 2-solutions of vector refinement equations with polynomially decaying masks and a general dilation matrix, which plays a vital
 role for characterizations of wavelets and biorthogonal wavelets with infinite support. A vector refinement equation with
 polynomially decaying masks and a general dilation matrix is the form: 
 
 
 
 
 $$ \phi(x)=\sum_{\alpha\in\Bbb Z^s}a(\alpha)\medspace\phi(Mx-\alpha),\quad x\in\Bbb R^s, $$
 
 
 
  where the vector of functions $$ Q_{a}f(x):=\sum_{\alpha\in\Bbb Z^s}a(\alpha)f(Mx-\alpha),\quad x\in\Bbb R^s, \quad f=(f_1,...,f_r)^T\in (L_2(\Bbb R^s))^r. $$
 
 
 
  The iterative scheme  is called vector cascade algorithm. In this paper we give a complete characterization of convergence of the sequence  in L
 2-norm. Some properties of the transition operator restricted to a certain linear space are discussed. As an application of
 convergence, we also obtain a characterization of smoothness of solutions of refinement equation mentioned above for the case
 r = 1.

CKBIJGaW.title: New Bounds for Restricted Isometry Constants With Coherent Tight Frames
CKBIJGaW.abstract: This paper discusses reconstruction of a signal from undersampled data in the situation that the signal is sparse or approximately sparse in terms of a (possibly) highly overcomplete and coherent tight frame $D$ via the $l_{1}$-analysis optimization problem. Some new sufficient conditions on the $D$ -restricted isometry property are given to guarantee stable recovery of signals which are nearly sparse in terms of $D$, from undersampled data with minimal $l_{1}$-norm of transform coefficients. One of the main results of this paper shows that if the $D$-restricted isometry constant $\\delta_{s}$ of the measurement matrix $A$ satisfies $\\delta_{s}<0.307$ , then signals which are approximately $s$-sparse in terms of $D$ are guaranteed to be stably recovered via the $l_{1}$-analysis optimization problem. We point out that with the lemmas and the proof techniques developed in this paper, most of the sufficient conditions on the standard restricted isometry property for stable recovery of nearly sparse signals via standard $l_{1}$ -minimization, can be similarly extended to the general case of the $D$-restricted isometry property for stable recovery of signals that are nearly sparse in terms of $D$ via the $l_{1}$-analysis optimization problem, yielding weaker conditions than previously available in the literature.

bN2fBurf.title: Inkjet printing assisted synthesis of multicomponent mesoporous metal oxides for ultrafast catalyst exploration.
bN2fBurf.abstract: We describe an inkjet printing assisted cooperative-assembly method for high-throughput generation of catalyst libraries (multicomponent mesoporous metal oxides) at a rate of 1,000,000-formulations/hour with up to eight-component compositions. The compositions and mesostructures of the libraries can be well-controlled and continuously varied. Fast identification of an inexpensive and efficient quaternary catalyst for photocatalytic hydrogen evolution is achieved via a multidimensional group testing strategy to reduce the number of performance validation experiments (25,000-fold reduction over an exhaustive one-by-one search).

oCR0gaAG.title: Convergence of Cascade Algorithms in Sobolev Spaces Associated with Multivariate Refinement Equations
oCR0gaAG.abstract: This paper is concerned with multivariate inhomogeneous refinement equations written in the form ϕ( x ) = ∑ α ∈ Z s a (α)ϕ ( Mx − α) + g ( x ), x ∈ R s , where ϕ is the unknown function defined on the s -dimentional Euclidean space R s , g is a given compactly supported function on R s , a is a finitely supported sequence on Z s , and M is an s × s dilation matrix with m = |det M |. Let ϕ 0 be an initial function in the Sobolev space W k 2 ( R s ). For n = 1, 2,…, define ϕ n ( x ) = ∑ α ∈ Z s a (α)ϕ n − 1 ( Mx − α) + g ( x ), x ∈ R s . In this paper, we give a characterization for the strong convergence in the Sobolev space W k 2 ( R s )( k ∈ N ) of the cascade sequence (ϕ n ) n ∈ N for the case in which M is isotropic. 7AHuBiN5.title: WaveletQuant, an improved quantification software based on wavelet signal threshold de-noising for labeled quantitative proteomic analysis.
7AHuBiN5.abstract: Quantitative proteomics technologies have been developed to comprehensively identify and quantify proteins in two or more complex samples. Quantitative proteomics based on differential stable isotope labeling is one of the proteomics quantification technologies. Mass spectrometric data generated for peptide quantification are often noisy, and peak detection and definition require various smoothing filters to remove noise in order to achieve accurate peptide quantification. Many traditional smoothing filters, such as the moving average filter, Savitzky-Golay filter and Gaussian filter, have been used to reduce noise in MS peaks. However, limitations of these filtering approaches often result in inaccurate peptide quantification. Here we present the WaveletQuant program, based on wavelet theory, for better or alternative MS-based proteomic quantification.We developed a novel discrete wavelet transform (DWT) and a 'Spatial Adaptive Algorithm' to remove noise and to identify true peaks. We programmed and compiled WaveletQuant using Visual C++ 2005 Express Edition. We then incorporated the WaveletQuant program in the Trans-Proteomic Pipeline (TPP), a commonly used open source proteomics analysis pipeline.We showed that WaveletQuant was able to quantify more proteins and to quantify them more accurately than the ASAPRatio, a program that performs quantification in the TPP pipeline, first using known mixed ratios of yeast extracts and then using a data set from ovarian cancer cell lysates. The program and its documentation can be downloaded from our website at http://systemsbiozju.org/data/WaveletQuant.

GFPxIra2.title: Multivariate refinement equation with nonnegative masks
GFPxIra2.abstract:
This paper is concerned with multivariate refinement equations of the type 
 
 
 
 
 $$\varphi = \sum\limits_{\alpha \in \mathbb{Z}^s } {a(\alpha )} \varphi (Mx - \alpha )$$
 
 
 
 
 
 , where ϕ is the unknown function defined on the s-dimensional Euclidean space ℝs, a is a finitely supported nonnegative sequence on ℤs, and M is an s s dilation matrix with m:=|detM|. We characterize the existence of L
 2-solution of refinement equation in terms of spectral radius of a certain finite matrix or transition operator associated
 with refinement mask a and dilation matrix M. For s = 1 and M = 2, the sufficient and necessary conditions are obtained to characterize the existence of continuous solution of this refinement
 equation.

MnGOcauC.title: Convergence and error estimate of cascade algorithms with infinitely supported masks in L p(ℝ s)
MnGOcauC.abstract: The cascade algorithm plays an important role in computer graphics and wavelet analysis. In this paper, we first investigate the convergence of cascade algorithms associated with a polynomially decaying mask and a general dilation matrix in L p(ℝ s) (1 ≥ p ≥ ∞) spaces, and then we give an error estimate of the cascade algorithms associated with truncated masks. It is proved that under some appropriate conditions if the cascade algorithm associated with a polynomially decaying mask converges in the L p-norm, then the cascade algorithms associated with the truncated masks also converge in the L p-norm. Moreover, the error between the two resulting limit functions is estimated in terms of the masks. © 2011 Science China Press and Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg.

rfET8tm8.title: Biorthogonal multiple wavelets generated by vector refinement equation
rfET8tm8.abstract:
Biorthogonal multiple wavelets are generated from refinable function vectors by using the multiresolution analysis. In this
 paper we provide a general method for the construction of compactly supported biorthogonal multiple wavelets by refinable
 function vectors which are the solutions of vector refinement equations of the form 
 
 
 
 
 $$\varphi (x) = \sum\limits_{\alpha \in \mathbb{Z}^s } {a(\alpha )\varphi (Mx - \alpha ), x \in \mathbb{R}^s } ,$$
 
 
 
 
 
  where the vector of functions ϕ = (ϕ
 1, …, ϕ
 r)T is in 
 $$(L_2 (\mathbb{R}^s ))^r ,a = :(a(\alpha ))_{\alpha \in \mathbb{Z}^s } $$
 is a finitely supported sequence of r × r matrices called the refinement mask, and M is an s × s integer matrix such that lim
 n→∞
 M
 −n
  = 0. Our characterizations are in the general setting and the main results of this paper are the real extensions of some
 known results.

fRqPfJc2.title: Subdivisions with infinitely supported mask
fRqPfJc2.abstract: In this paper we investigate the convergence of subdivision schemes associated with masks being polynomially decay sequences. Two-scale vector refinement equations are the form@f(x)=@?@a@?Za(@a)@f(2x-@a),x@?R,where the vector of functions @f=(@f"1,...,@f"r)^T is in (L"2(R))^r and a@?(a(@a))"@a"@?"Z is polynomially decay sequence of rxr matrices called refinement mask. Associated with the mask a is a linear operator on (L"2(R))^r given byQ"af(x)@?@?@a@?Za(@a)f(2x-@a),x@?R,f=(f"1,...,f"r)^T@?(L"2(R))^r.By using same methods in [B. Han, R. Q. Jia, Characterization of Riesz bases of wavelets generated from multiresolution analysis, manuscript]; [B. Han, Refinable functions and cascade algorithms in weighted spaces with infinitely supported masks, manuscript]; [R.Q. Jia, Q.T. Jiang, Z.W. Shen, Convergence of cascade algorithms associated with nonhomogeneous refinement equations, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 129 (2001) 415-427]; [R.Q. Jia, Convergence of vector subdivision schemes and construction of biorthogonal multiple wavelets, in: Advances in Wavelet, Hong Kong,1997, Springer, Singapore, 1998, pp. 199-227], a characterization of convergence of the sequences (Q"a^nf)"n"="1","2","... in the L"2-norm is given, which extends the main results in [R.Q. Jia, S.D. Riemenschneider, D.X. Zhou, Vector subdivision schemes and multiple wavelets, Math. Comp. 67 (1998) 1533-1563] on convergence of the subdivision schemes associated with a finitely supported mask to the case in which mask a is polynomially decay sequence. As an application, we also obtain a characterization of smoothness of solutions of the refinement equation mentioned above for the case r=1.

aCuI3CtY.title: Besov spaces and K-functionals in Lp, 0 < P < 1
aCuI3CtY.abstract: We investigate Besov spaces and their connection with trigonometric polynomial approximation in Lp[-π,π], algebraic polynomial approximation in Lp[-1,1], algebraic polynomial approximation in LP(S), and entire function of exponential type approximation in LP(R), and characterize K-functionals for certain pairs of function spaces including (Lp[-π,π], Bs α(LP[-π,π])), (LP(R),B s α(LP(R))), (LP[-1,1],B s -α(Lp[-1,1])), and (L p(S),Bs =α(Lp(S))), where 0<s≤∞, 0<p<1, S is a simple polytope and 0<α<r.

bABULgl4.title: Regularity of refinable functions with exponentially decaying masks
bABULgl4.abstract: The regularity of refinable functions is an important issue in all multiresolution analysis and has a strong impact on applications of wavelets to image processing, geometric and numerical solutions of elliptic partial differential equations. The purpose of this paper is to characterize the regularity of refinable functions with exponentially decaying masks and a dilation matrix whose eigenvalues have the same modulus. The main results of this paper are really extensions of some results in Cohen et al. (1999) [5] , Jia (1999) [17] and Lorentz and Oswald (2000) [28] .

Q7HlPbEn.title: New bounds on the restricted isometry constant δ 2 k
Q7HlPbEn.abstract: Restricted isometry constants play an important role in compressed sensing. In the literature, E.J. Candès has proven that δ2 k<2-1≈0.4142 is a sufficient condition for the l1 minimization problem having a k-sparse solution. Later, S. Foucart and M. Lai have improved the condition to δ2k<0.4531 and S. Foucart has improved the bound to δ2k<0.4652. In 2010, T. Cai, L. Wang and G. Xu have improved the condition to δ2k<0.4721 for the cases such that k is a multiple of 4 or k is very large and S. Foucart has improved the bound to δ2k<0.4734 for large values of k. In this paper, we have improved the sufficient condition to δ2 k<0.4931 for general k. Also, in some special cases, the sufficient condition can be improved to δ2k<0.6569. These new bounds have several benefits on recovering compressible signals with noise. © 2011 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

PiU8aCN2.title: Convergence rates of vector cascade algorithms in Lp
PiU8aCN2.abstract: We investigate the solutions of vector refinement equations of the form ϕ= ∑ α ∈ Zs a(α)ϕ(M ċ - α), where the vector of functions ϕ = (ϕ1.....ϕr)T is in (Lp(Rs))r, 1 ≤ p ≤ ∞, a =: (a(α))α ∈ Zs is a finitely supported sequence of r × r matrices called the refinement mask, and M is an s × s integer matrix such that limn → ∞ M-n = 0. Associated with the mask a and M is a linear operator Qa defined on (Lp(Rs))r by Qaψ := ∑β ∈ Zsa(β)ψ(M ċ-β). The iteration scheme (Qanψ)n = 1.2,... is called a cascade algorithm (see [D.R. Chen, R.Q. Jia, S.D. Riemenschneider, Convergence of vector subdivision schemes in Sobolev spaces, Appl. Comput. Harmon. Anal. 12 (2002) 128-149; B. Han, The initial functions in a cascade algorithm, in: D.X. Zhou (Ed.), Proceeding of International Conference of Computational Harmonic Analysis in Hong Kong, 2002; B. Han, R.Q. Jia, Multivariate refinement equations and convergence of subdivision schemes, SIAM J. Math. Anal. 29 (1998) 1177-1199; R.Q. Jia, Subdivision schemes in Lp spaces, Adv. Comput. Math. 3 (1995) 309-341; R.Q. Jia, S.D. Riemenschneider, D.X. Zhou, Vector subdivision schemes and multiple wavelets, Math. Comp. 67 (1998) 1533-1363; S. Li, Characterization of smoothness of multivariate refinable functions and convergence of cascade algorithms associated with nonhomogeneous refinement equations, Adv. Comput. Math. 20 (2004) 311-331; Q. Sun, Convergence and boundedness of cascade algorithm in Besov space and Triebel-Lizorkin space I, Adv. Math. (China) 29 (2000) 507-526]). Cascade algorithm is an important issue to wavelets analysis and computer graphics. Main results of this paper are related to the convergence and convergence rates of vector cascade algorithm in (Lp(Rs))r (1 ≤ p ≤ ∞). We give some characterizations on convergence of cascade algorithm and also give estimates on convergence rates of this cascade algorithm with M being isotropic dilation matrix. It is well known that smoothness is a very important property of a multiple refinable function. A characterization of Lp(1 ≤ p ≤ ∞) smoothness of multiple refinable functions is also presented when M = qIs × s, where Is×s is the s×s identity matrix, and q ≥ 2 is an integer. In particular, the smoothness results given in [R.Q. Jia, S.D. Riemenschneider, D.X. Zhou, Smoothness of multiple refinable functions and multiple wavelets, SIAM J. Matrix Anal. Appl. 21 (1999) 1-28] is a special case of this paper.

OFk1OIyD.title: Convergence rates of cascade algorithms associated with nonhomogeneous refinement equations
OFk1OIyD.abstract: This paper is concerned with nonhomogeneous refinement equations of the form ϕ(x)= ∑ α∈ Z s a(α)ϕ(Mx−α)+g(x), x∈ R s , where the vector of functions ϕ =( ϕ 1 ,…, ϕ r ) T is unknown, g is a given vector of compactly supported functions on R s , a is a finitely supported sequence of r × r matrices called the refinement mask, and M is an s × s integer matrix such that lim n →∞ M − n =0. Our approach will be to consider the convergence rates of the cascade algorithms associated with nonhomogeneous refinement equations mentioned above. The cascade algorithms associated with mask a , nonhomogeneous term  g , and dilation matrix M generates a sequence ϕ n , n =1,2,…, by the iterative process ϕ n (x)= ∑ α∈ Z s a(α)ϕ n−1 (Mx−α)+g(x), x∈ R s , from a starting vector of function ϕ 0 in (L p ( R s )) r (0< p ⩽∞). The aim of this paper is to give a characterization of the convergence rates of the cascade algorithms associated with a , g , ϕ 0 and dilation matrix M in (L p ( R s )) r (0< p ⩽∞) in terms of the p -norm joint spectral radius of a finite collection of some linear operators determined by the sequence a and the set E restricted to a certain invariant subspace, where the set E is a complete set of representatives of the distinct cosets of the quotient group Z s /M Z s containing 0. Some examples are provided to illustrate the method. Keywords Nonhomogeneous refinement equation Joint spectral radius Cascade algorithms L p ( R s ) (0< p ⩽∞) space Convergence rates

kT1wA58C.title: Ductile Titanium Alloy with Low Poisson’s Ratio
kT1wA58C.abstract: We report a ductile beta-type titanium alloy with body-centered cubic (bcc) crystal structure having a low Poisson's ratio of 0.14. The almost identical ultralow bulk and shear moduli of approximately 24 GPa combined with an ultrahigh strength of approximately 0.9 GPa contribute to easy crystal distortion due to much-weakened chemical bonding of atoms in the crystal, leading to significant elastic softening in tension and elastic hardening in compression. The peculiar elastic and plastic deformation behaviors of the alloy are interpreted as a result of approaching the elastic limit of the bcc crystal under applied stress.

sSpX4tdb.title: A Study of the Characteristics of Graphite Electrode Response to Solution pH
sSpX4tdb.abstract: A systematic experiment has been carried out to explore the pH response characteristics of the solid graphite electrode and the response performance of it when mixed with PbO,PbO2和PbS.The experiment shows that when pH is within the extension of 1-9,the pure graphite sheet electrode is of a nice linearity,the Nernst Slope is 48.3mv/pH.The electrode,with a high intensity,being heat and pressure resistance,has no internal ref- erence.Na+,K+,NH4+,Cl-,13402 -7,P02-4,HP02-4 and phthalic acid wont interfere with the pH of the electrode(?) response.
